items.title: Software Engineer, iOS - Remote at Numbrs () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Finance
Company size: 51-200 people

Job description

Responsibilities include but are not limited to developing, releasing, monitoring and troubleshooting native iOS and Watch applications. Applicants are also expected to participate in after-hours work.

All candidates will have

  • a Bachelor's or higher degree in technical field of study
  • a minimum of five years' experience developing, monitoring and troubleshooting native iOS applications with significant interaction with backend systems
  • excellent knowledge and hands-on experience with Swift and Objective-C programming languages
  • expert level knowledge of Core Data
  • experience collaborating with UI/UX designers
  • excellent troubleshooting and creative problem-solving abilities
  • excellent written and oral communication and interpersonal skills

Ideally, candidates will also have

  • experience with encryption and cryptography standards
  • experience with large-scale iOS applications
  • experience with at least one backend language such as Go, C/C++, Java and Scala

Location: Remote

About Numbrs

Numbrs' focus is on developing products to manage banking transactions and assets. The platform provides banking services for the consumer, as well as the development and implementation of banking software towards financial institutions. We are currently looking for a Software Engineer, iOS - Remote, at the earliest possible start date, to strengthen our position in the industry.

What we offer

  • Technology - Only the most cutting-edge technologies are used and we are constantly innovating. Our technical architecture is based on the use of Microservices, a block chain technology, and a proprietary machine learning technology.
  • Self-development - We offer to our employees a clear career chances by offering an experts and manager career path that ensures equal development opportunities.
  • Work / life balance - Work/life balance is important to us, which is why we offer flexible work schedules.
  • Salary - We offer highly competitive salaries. Our salary formula adjusts to your experience and cost of living.

Benefits

free breakfast, lunch and snacks
coffee and drinks
pool and kicker
modern workplace
paid vacation

items.title: C++ expert; web crawling or web API experience strongly preferred at Core Data () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Big Data, Developer APIs, Sports betting odds algorithms
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Core Data has an opening for two (2) experienced senior-level C++ programmers to add to our EU-based remote work team.  This work-from-home contract style position offers a full time opportunity to each developer selected for the position.  Candidates selected for this position will work under a full-time independent contractor relationship with our EU-based division.

C++ is the main programming language used on company projects; however, candidates are expected to be "full stack" and have experience in web APIs, web services, JSON, etc, since nearly all of our in-house applications either produce or consume web services.  Many of the services we interact with are undocumented or legacy code, so patience and investigative skills to determine how a given remote API works and how to extract the needed information from it are of the highest importance.  Many projects will involve creation of web bots, crawlers, or automatic web scraping programs to gather data from specified sites or endpoints.

For this position, emphasis is placed on the applicant's ability to produce solutions with minimal outside help.  As this is a senior-level position, all applicants are expected to be able to write the required applications from start to finish, including design of any database queries or tables.  Design specifications will be provided for each project prior to commencement.  While actual programming ability is one of the key requirements of this position, applicants for this senior-level posting are expected to show initiative and take a practical approach towards solving real-world problems.

Most of the applications developed at Core Data are related to data feeds for sports odds, betting, and statistics.

About Core Data

Core Data is a data and statistics provider with an emphasis on low-latency, real-time sports data feeds. Core Data's product lineup is the backbone of a variety of innovative products, including live score trackers, play by play game trackers, and real-time AI-based odds. The company's statistics database includes detailed play by play records for past matchups across 22 sports. Additionally, Core Data's low-latency real-time data feeds offer live coverage on over 18,000 events monthly. The company offers a variety of pricing structures, ranging from starter plans that allow clients to choose events on a pay-as-you-go basis to comprehensive monthly packages that include all major leagues and sports.

Benefits

Monthly paid time off
Competitive Compensation
Flexible hours / work schedules

items.title: Technical Writer at VividCortex (Chicago, IL) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Industry: Databases, Information Services, Information Technology
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

About the role

The Technical Content Writer and Journalist develops the voice of VividCortex to create thought leadership content around business, strategy, technology, and future trends. You assist in the execution and distribution of content through various content vehicles, such as company blogs, whitepapers, ebooks, and product videos to help prospects fully understand the value of VividCortex in an engaging, brand-centric manner. You form strong partnerships with leaders inside and outside the organization, and help them turn their ideas into compelling content. You will report to the CMO and are a key member of our Marketing team.

Key Responsibilities:

    • Brainstorm, research, write, and distribute articles, blog posts, case studies, eBooks, whitepapers, and more, that are authoritative, clear, and informative and meets the needs of both key stakeholders and unique personas and user buyer journey stages.
    • Continually work with the extended marketing team to measure reader engagement, and iterate to improve content definition, distribution, and performance.
    • Engage with development team routinely to gain a full understanding of recent product releases and newest features to better understand ways to position VividCortex in the market.
    • Assist with the creation and development of print collateral such as brochures for tradeshows or events.
    • Work with customers for case studies/testimonials.
    • Balance content distribution efforts, producing a regular cadence of blog content, repositioning high-performing pieces, and managing the development long-tail content assets.

Requirements:

    • History of working with B2B organizations developing technology and business content in a regular cadence, or tech journalism experience.
    • Skilled and polished writer who can transform ideas and interviews into content quickly and efficiently.
    • Passion to combine strong writing skills with a love of technology.
    • Interested in the world of business and technology and love to read and write about it.
    • Ability to build a pipeline of successful content based on interviews with thought leaders.
    • Experience writing regular blog content that sparks a conversation.
    • Academic or professional experience in technical writing and or journalism.
    • Located in the Washington, DC or Chicago area, and available for occasional travel.

At VividCortex, we want to build a diverse team because it's the right thing to do, and because we believe diversity is strength. We encourage applicants from all walks of life and all backgrounds.

Note to Agencies and Recruiters: VividCortex has a strict company policy against engaging with unsolicited contact from agencies or recruiters.  Unsolicited resumes and leads are property of VividCortex and VividCortex explicitly denies that any information sent to VividCortex can be construed as consideration.

About VividCortex

VividCortex is a modern database monitoring platform that gives developers and DBAs deep visibility into the database. Our solution is delivered as software-as-a-service and helps our customers see and analyze the work their databases are doing in great detail. It addresses critical pain points in measuring and managing today's large, distributed, diverse storage tiers composed of multiple different clustered products, all working together.

Founded in 2012 by noted database experts, and backed by major venture capital and high-wealth individuals, VividCortex is headquartered in Charlottesville, Virginia with a remote team in Montevideo, Uruguay. With more than 750% year-over-year growth, VividCortex is a company on fire!

We have a fast-growing customer base of well-known companies, and a tremendous reputation in our market for delivering a high-quality, innovative solution for database performance problems that are common in tens of thousands of small and large organizations.

Benefits

Unlimited paid leave for any purpose (incl. maternity and paternity)
Excellent medical insurance and dental benefits
Equity
New MacBook or other Mac computer, as best suited to the position
Gym membership. We have quite a few CrossFitters at the office
A nerdy sense of humor, tax-free
Premium coffee, frequent team meals, snacks, and more

items.title: Interview Engineer at Karat () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer, Backend Developer
Industry: Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

About Karat

Karat has reengineered technical hiring to ensure that great talent gets noticed by great companies.   We augment engineering organizations by conducting the first-rounds of technical interviews on their behalf. Our service saves material engineering time and drives a highly responsive and consistent experience for candidates.  Karat continuously invests in cutting edge interview methodologies with an aim of reducing bias and letting candidates demonstrate their true ability. We operate as strategic partners for engineering leaders at the world's leading technology companies including Jet, MuleSoft, Roblox, Intuit, Ten-X, Minted and many more.   As the gold standard of technical interviewing, our well-funded company is scaling quickly to meet our growing list of client's needs.  Come join us!

About The Job

Our dedicated Interview Engineers are deeply passionate about the art and science of interviewing.   As an Interview Engineer, you will conduct the first-rounds of technical interviews on behalf of Karat's clients. Karat interviews take place live over video, allowing our Interview Engineers to interact with candidates from all over the world without leaving their home.  You will play an important role in the hiring process and will uphold the highest standards of candidate experience, fairness and trust.  We are very selective in hiring Interview Engineers onto the Karat platform.   Once you join our community, we will be focused on your success as a highly-regarded technical interviewer.

About You:

  • You're passionate about improving the technical interview process.
  • You care about helping others improve themselves through a great interview experience.
  • You lead with empathy and are driven to provide consistent and thoughtful feedback to candidates.
  • Your written and verbal communication skills are superb.
  • You've accumulated significant experience evaluating fundamental computer science skills (i.e. data structures, algorithms etc.), software craftsmanship (i.e. understanding of unit testing, source control, APIs etc.), and/or specific technologies (i.e. iOS, distributed systems etc.).
  • You are interested in working 40 hours per week or more.

About Karat

Interviewing is broken.  Karat professionalizes interviewing.

  • Karat is on a mission to assess the world's talent.  We are the first dedicated marketplace for technical interviewers. Karat's network of seasoned engineers conduct the first rounds of technical interviews for elite engineering companies. Our robust platform saves teams thousands of valuable hours while allowing them to focus on the top performing candidates.  Karat's unique approach recognizes that people are central to the hiring process and that they can be supercharged by leveraging machine learning and our rich database of the world's interviews.

Benefits

Flexible Hours - You own your schedule
Work from anywhere
Transparent compensation
Bonus programs
Regular company outings
Access to a world-class community of expert interviewers

items.title: Front-End Developer (Remote) at ZEPPELIN Inc. () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Frontend Developer, Mobile Developer
Industry: Branding, Design
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

[About Us]

We are ZEPPELIN, the team behind FEELiT - an upcoming mobile broadcasting App and Web platform. We welcome broad minded, results-oriented thinkers, who can identify with human-centered design and pay great attention to meaningful experiences. WE CREATE BEAUTIFUL WORLDS.

[Process]

Please provide us with your resume, comprehensive portfolio is a must. Include your rate in your application as well. We will speak with selected candidates on Skype.

[Role]

It is a rare opportunity of changing the video industry through some best in class products that we build together. You will be responsible for creating and launching top-quality Web experience of FEELiT. The process would require smooth collaboration with our Crew members who are responsible for design, servers and iOS App. This is a remote role (it may evolve into full-time position in the future).

About ZEPPELIN Inc.

ZEPPELIN inspires businesses. Human beings are the foundation of our process. We believe in autonomy and organic growth of each and everyone of us. We acknowledge challenges as learning experiences. They nurture our vision and develop our originality.

WE CREATE BEAUTIFUL WORLDS.

Benefits

Flex Time Work
ZEP Lunch / Handmade Food
Holiday for good EXPERIENCE
Free Coffee
Harajuku located

items.title: Senior iOS Developer at MultiTracks.com (Austin, TX) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Mobile Development, Music, Web Development
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

We're looking for an experienced iOS Developer to join our fantastic development team for our MultiTrack app called Playback and some pre-launch products that are going to be exciting to be a part of. Our team is a fun group of highly creative, sharp, and innovative people working on a challenging suite of apps that push the boundaries as we blur the lines of creating, iterating and developing as a team. We're looking for motivated individuals that love to take initiative and write great code that will impact lots of people in meaningful ways.  Find out more about our flagship iOS product Playback.

About MultiTracks.com

We are a financially stable and rapidly growing tech company and we genuinely care about the products we build.  We're building an ecosystem of products for live performance that really make a difference in the lives of worship leaders that serve in their local churches. We work with the top record labels and artists in our industry and our website hosts the largest online catalog of Original Artist MultiTracks licensed and distributed to musicians around the world.  Our websites are MultiTracks.com, Secuencias.com and MultiTracks.com.br

Benefits

Competitive Salary
Paid Vacation
Whatever you need.
Competitive Packages
Remote Work Optional
Comfortable Work Environment
Health Insurance

items.title: TallyGo: Senior iOS Developer (who plays the theremin)
items.content:
Senior iOS Developer (who plays the theremin)

Posted Oct 26

TallyGo
Headquarters: Los Angeles
http://www.tallygo.com

Ever been stuck in traffic and thought to yourself, "This totally blows." And then you thought, "Now I'm so cranky I'm gonna need to play my theremin to calm down." Well, now you have a chance to help theremin players everywhere free themselves from all this GD traffic gridlock.

As a Senior iOS Developer at TallyGo, you will be part of a small, distributed team of scientists and engineers working on the cutting edge of navigation, route planning, and transportation science. Your job will be to help build out the SDK and apps that brings our vision to life. We are creating robust services that leverage sophisticated graph algorithms so that consumers and businesses can steer clear of traffic, save time and money, and reduce congestion on our roads. Bottom line: We're here to save people's sanity and put them back in control.

Note: This job requires that you play the theremin in our polka metal band called "Peekaboo Slugfest". (Not really, but wouldn't that be awesome!)

Must Have Skills
  • iOS developer with 5+ years experience
  • Published at least one iOS app
  • Published at least one iOS framework
  • Experience with Swift
  • Experience working with remote teams
  • Excellent English communication skills

Nice to Have Skills
  • Experience with mapping, navigation, and/or search APIs

Skills You Don't Need
  • Operate an industrial meat slicer, touch your elbow with your tongue, skip a stone on a pond

Our Values
  • Humble and open minded
  • Transparent and honest
  • Self directed and dependable
  • Positive and friendly
  • Sense of humor
  • No ego, no assholes

Working With Us
  • We have an office in LA and so prefer somebody in this area.
  • We are open to the possibility of work from home for the right person.
  • The work is challenging, with very compelling problems that touch on complex machine learning algorithms and scalability issues.
  • The work matters, and can have a huge impact on the economy and the environment.
  • You'll have the autonomy to direct your own work without being micromanaged.

Apply for this position

If this sounds interesting, please email us at jobs@tallygo.com. Please send your resume, links to a code repo or portfolio of your work, and tell us why Van Halen's standard performance contract contained a provision calling for them to be provided backstage with a bowl of M&Ms from which all the brown candies had been removed. Also, take a guess at why we are asking for that.Principals only, please, no recruiters.
